title: Sukkah
text: And Rabbah says from here In Sukkot you'll live 7 days, said the Torah all the seven days leave from the dewlling {thats} permanent and live in a dwelling {thats} temporary. Until 20 cubits a man makes his dwelling am=n impermanent dwelling, above 20 amah a person does not make his dwelling an impermanent dwelling rather a permanent dwelling
Abaye said to him: Rather {if he} now he makes separators/walls of bronze and a roof rests over them, here too this is not a sukkah

He said to him this is what I am telling you. Until 20 amah (cubits) that a man makes his dwelling an impermanent dwelling, like a permanent dwelling, also fulfills. Above 20 amah that a man makes his dwelling a permanent dwelling, as though it was impermanent {unsturdy}, does not fulfill {the obligation}
Rav Cheskiah said in the name of Rav Yermiah who said in the name of Rabbi Shimon Bar Yochai: I am able to exempt the entire world of judgment.
